definition: variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to destroy by fire/a blaze
to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to defame/to slander
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: The feedback will become so strong it destroys the wormhole.
sentences.chinese: 反馈变得很强大而毁坏了虫洞。

sentences.english: Last summer, a hailstorm damaged the ten mu of good land.
sentences.chinese: 冰雹毁坏了农作物，甚至打死了牲畜。

sentences.english: 99 percent of lawyers give the rest a bad name.
sentences.chinese: 百分之九十九的律师是毁坏律师界名声的大老鼠。

sentences.english: Threaded holes and studs shall be in good condition and not damaged or worn in any way.
sentences.chinese: 有螺纹的孔和螺栓应完好，并无任何毁坏或磨损。

sentences.english: Houses, properties got damaged and many people found cattle dead after their disaster.
sentences.chinese: 灾害后，房屋被毁坏，耕牛死亡。

sentences.english: The walls are partly destroyed, however, the forge grids remain.
sentences.chinese: 墙体已有部分毁坏，然而，窗户的铁丝网还在。

sentences.english: The next morning, she saw that part of the pierhead had broken away.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早上，她看到突堤前端的那一部分已经毁坏。

sentences.english: With the sword they will destroy the fortified cities in which you trust.
sentences.chinese: 又必用刀毁坏你所倚靠的坚固城。

sentences.english: The loss of the explosion which completely destoryed the garage can't be measured.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸彻底地毁坏了车库，其损失是难以衡量的。

sentences.english: Also, observe the average number of connections created and destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 同时，观察已创建和已毁坏连接的平均数。

sentences.english: This causes the aluminum to slowly corrode and eventually fail.
sentences.chinese: 这就导致铝支架慢慢被腐蚀致毁坏。

sentences.english: The windstorm blew down their houses.
sentences.chinese: 风暴毁坏了他们的房屋。

sentences.english: The imps are a real annoyance for any Hero gifted in magic, as they have the ability to destroy mana from any enemy hero.
sentences.chinese: 小鬼带给英雄最大的麻烦，就是毁坏魔法值的能力。

sentences.english: Would all of you throw him down- this leaning wall, this tottering fence?
sentences.chinese: 如同毁坏歪斜的墙，将倒的壁，要到几时呢？

sentences.english: He would never ravage flowers, certainly not in a cemetery.
sentences.chinese: 而他从不会毁坏花草，当然也不会是在公墓里。

definition: to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy
to burn down/to destroy with fire/trad. also written 焚毀
to burn down/to destroy with fire
to blow up/to destroy with explosives
to level/to raze to the ground
